question: The three main layers of Snowflake are…

What statement is true about Snowflake's unique architecture?
What is the storage hierarchy in Snowflake?

Can two Virtual Warehouses access the same data simultaneously without any contention issues?
Are the interactions with data initialized through the services layer?
Can the table functions in INFORMATION_SCHEMA be used to return account-level usage and historical information for storage, warehouses, user logins, and queries?
Is Snowflake available on-premise?
What are the three Snowflake editions offered when you sign up for a Snowflake trial account?
Which Snowflake edition supports private communication between Snowflake and your other VPCs through AWS PrivateLink?
Which cloud provider is not supported by Snowflake?
Does Snowflake automatically stores data in encrypted form in all editions?
In which Snowflake edition is Tri-Secret Secure option available?
Can we use Multi-factor Authentication to connect to Snowflake via the Snowflake JDBC driver?
A client has ODBC or JDBC available in their systems, but they do not have the Snowflake drivers. Is the client able to connect to Snowflake?
What is the name of Snowflake’s Command Line Interface tool?
What influences Snowflake pricing? (SELECT ONLY ONE)
choices: Amount of data queried from Snowflake.
Amount of data scanned from Snowflake.
Snowflake pricing is based on usage & storage.
correct_answers: Snowflake pricing is based on usage & storage.

question: Compute cost in Snowflake depends on…
choices: The query execution time and the waiting query time.
The warehouse size and how long the warehouse runs.
correct_answers: The warehouse size and how long the warehouse runs.

question: What are the two major cost categories in Snowflake? (SELECT TWO)
How is the data storage cost computed for Snowflake?
choices: Based on the average daily amount of uncompressed data stored.
Based on the average daily amount of compressed data stored.
Based on the amount of uncompressed data stored on the last day of the month.
Based on the amount of compressed data stored on the last day of the month.
correct_answers: Based on the average daily amount of compressed data stored.

question: Which type of data incur Snowflake storage cost?
Do tables with Fail-Safe turned on incur additional storage costs compared to tables where Fail-Safe is turned off?
Does data stored in a temporary table not contribute to Snowflake’s storage cost?
Which factors influence the unit cost of Snowflake credits and data storage?
What technique does Snowflake use to limit the number of micro-partitions retrieved as part of a query?
Which statements are correct about micro-partitions in Snowflake?
Which options are correct regarding the data that is stored in micro-partition metadata?
choices: The range of values for each of the columns in the micro-partition.
Additional properties are used for both optimization and efficient query processing.
correct_answers: The range of values for each of the columns in the micro-partition.
Additional properties are used for both optimization and efficient query processing.

question: What techniques would you consider to improve the performance of a query that takes a lot of time to return any result?
choices: Create cluster keys & turn auto clustering on the table
Create an index on the search result
correct_answers: Create cluster keys & turn auto clustering on the table

question: Which of the following clustering metadata for the micro-partitions is maintained by Snowflake in a table?
choices: The number of micro-partitions that comprise the table.
The number of micro-partitions containing values that overlap with each other.
The depth of the overlapping micro-partitions.
correct_answers: The number of micro-partitions that comprise the table.
The number of micro-partitions containing values that overlap with each other.
The depth of the overlapping micro-partitions.

question: Which of the below will you consider while choosing a cluster key
choices: Columns that are typically used in the selective filters.
Columns are frequently used in join predicates.
correct_answers: Columns that are typically used in the selective filters.
Columns are frequently used in join predicates.

question: Does re-clustering in Snowflake require manual configuration?
Is re-clustering in Snowflake only triggered if the table would benefit from the operation?
What can you easily check to see if a large table will benefit from explicitly defining a clustering key?
Which system functions are available in Snowflake to view/monitor the clustering metadata for a table?
Is clustering generally more cost-effective for frequently queried tables and do not change often?
Which of the below columns is usually a good choice for clustering keys?
choices: UUID column from a Customer in a 10TB table.

question: What types of tables are available in Snowflake?
What types of views are available in Snowflake?

We need to temporarily store intermediate data, which an ETL process will only use. We don’t need the data outside the ETL process. If you want to optimize storage cost, what type of table will you create to store this data?
Can you use streams to track changes in materialized view?
In which of the below scenarios will you use an external table?
choices: You have data on the cloud providers, but the data cannot be copied or moved to any other location due to compliance regulations.
You have a high volume of data on the cloud providers, but we only need some of the data in Snowflake.
You have data on the cloud providers that need to be updated by Snowflake.
You have XML data on the cloud provider.
correct_answers: You have data on the cloud providers, but the data cannot be copied or moved to any other location due to compliance regulations.
You have a high volume of data on the cloud providers, but we only need some of the data in Snowflake.

question: Select two limitations with materialized views:

An external location like Amazon S3 or Azure.
correct_answers: Named external stage that references an external location (Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage, or Microsoft Azure).
An external location like Amazon S3 or Azure.

question: After how many days does the COPY INTO load metadata expire?

choices: We have a small volume of frequent data
We have a huge volume of data generated as part of a batch schedule
In both of the previous scenarios
correct_answers: We have a small volume of frequent data

question: Is Snowpipe Serverless?

choices: After an average time of 5 seconds

question: Can you resize the warehouse once you have selected the size?

choices: Contact Snowflake support to increase the size of the warehouse

question: A warehouse ran for 62 seconds, and it was suspended. After some time, it ran for another 20 seconds. For how many seconds will you be billed?

A medium (M) warehouse has auto-suspend configured after 15 minutes. You have noticed that all of the queries that run on this warehouse finish within a minute. What will you do to optimize compute costs?
choices: Delete the warehouse after a minute
Reduce the auto-suspend time to 1 minute
correct_answers: Reduce the auto-suspend time to 1 minute

question: What happens to incoming queries when a warehouse does not have enough resources to process them?
choices: Queries are queued and executed when the warehouse has resources

question: Which function returns the name of the warehouse of the current session?

Manage access to Snowflake for specific users

correct_answers: Help control costs associated with unexpected warehouse credit usage

question: What can the resource monitor associated with a Warehouse do when it reaches (or is about to) hit the limit?
choices: Kill the query that is running
correct_answers: Kill the query that is running

question: What is the property name from the Resource Monitors that lets you specify whether you want to control the credit usage of your entire account or a specific set of warehouses?

What are the different caching mechanisms available in Snowflake?
A query executed a couple of hours ago, which took more than 5 minutes to run, is executed again, and it returned the results in less than a second. What might have happened?
choices: Snowflake used the persisted query results from the metadata cache
Snowflake used the persisted query results from the query result cache
Snowflake used the persisted query results from the warehouse cache
A new Snowflake version has been released in the last two hours, improving the speed of the service
correct_answers: Snowflake used the persisted query results from the query result cache

question: Are Snowflake caches automatically invalidated if the underlying data changes?

choices: Data stored in cloud storage like AWS

question: What should be the first option to restore data into a table?

Which Snowflake edition (and above) allows until 90 days of Time Travel?
Do you need to contact Snowflake Support to retrieve data from Fail-Safe?
Is the Fail-Safe period for temporary and transient tables 0?
Select the statements that are true about Fail-Safe:
choices: There is no difference between Time-Travel and Fail-Safe
The data retention period for a permanent table with 30 days of Time-Travel is 37 days
Fail-Safe ensures that historical data is protected in the event of a system failure or other catastrophic events
correct_answers: The data retention period for a permanent table with 30 days of Time-Travel is 37 days
Fail-Safe ensures that historical data is protected in the event of a system failure or other catastrophic events

question: A point-in-time snapshot of data that users can update is called…
Which service does Snowflake use to provide the Zero-Copy cloning functionality?
choices: SSD Cache of the Virtual Warehouses

question:
What would happen if we executed the following command?
CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE newTable CLONE table1;
choices: “newTable” is created with all the data from “table1”
“newTable” is created, and Snowflake internally executes a batch job to copy all the data from “table1”
“newTable” is created, and Snowflake internally executes a pipe to copy all the data from “table1”
Snowflake creates a new entry in the metadata store to keep track of the new clone. The existing micro-partitions of “table1” are mapped to the new table.
correct_answers: Snowflake creates a new entry in the metadata store to keep track of the new clone. The existing micro-partitions of “table1” are mapped to the new table.

question: Which answers are true about roles in Snowflake?
choices: Snowflake users have a limit on the number of roles that they can assume
Snowflake users can have one or more roles
Only a role can be active for a particular session
Privileges can be directly assigned to users
correct_answers: Snowflake users can have one or more roles
Only a role can be active for a particular session

question: Which of the following object types are stored within a schema?

choices: This is not a problem; producers and consumers can be in different regions
Replicate your account to another region and create a share from that region.
Create a script to replicate your data in the consumer account.
correct_answers: Replicate your account to another region and create a share from that region.

question: Which Snowflake role can set up a Snowflake Share?

A task can execute multiple SQL Statements

A task can execute a function
correct_answers: A task can execute a single SQL Statement

question: A task is still being executed before the next scheduled task. What is going to happen with the new scheduled task?
choices: Snowflake will wait for the previous task to complete

question: Which roles or privileges are required to view TASK_HISTORY?

question: What is one disadvantage of the shared disk architecture? Choose one correct value.
choices: When a node in the cluster fails data is reshuffled which can be an expensive process.
The storage is potentially a single point of failure.
Shared disk architectures cannot exist in the Cloud.
There is a single source of truth.
correct_answers: The storage is potentially a single point of failure.

question: What is one disadvantage of the shared nothing architecture? Choose one correct value.
choices: Avoids bandwidth and network latency limitations of shared disk architectures.
Storage and compute is tightly coupled.
Shared nothing architectures cannot exist on the Cloud.
correct_answers: Storage and compute is tightly coupled.

question: What makes Snowflake a “cloud native” product? Choose one correct value.
choices: Snowflake ported existing “big-data” technologies on to the cloud.
Snowflake was designed to make use of the unique capabilities of the cloud.
Snowflake runs on a combination of cloud and on-prem infrastructure.
correct_answers: Snowflake was designed to make use of the unique capabilities of the cloud.

question: Snowflake is a ANSI compliant SQL database. True or false?

Which statement is incorrect regarding snowflake editions? Choose one correct value.
choices: Standard edition accounts have the Time Travel feature.
Enterprise edition encompasses all the features of standard edition.
Business critical edition accounts have additional support for regulation compliance around data protection.
Virtual private Snowflakes allows the user to host a deployment of Snowflake on their on-premise infrastructure.
correct_answers: Virtual private Snowflakes allows the user to host a deployment of Snowflake on their on-premise infrastructure.

If the role ACCOUNTADMIN was currently active, what would a user see issuing a query that included an email column with the below column masking policy applied to it?



CREATE MASKING POLICY EMAIL_MASK AS (VAL STRING) RETURN STRING ->

  CASE

      WHEN CURRENT_ROLE() IN ('ADMIN') THEN VAL

      WHEN CURRENT_USER() IN ('DEVELOPER') THEN REGEXP_REPLACE(VAL, '.+@', '*****@')

  ELSE '*********'

      END;

Choose one value.

choices: A: micro-partitioning has been known to introduce data skew
B: micro-partiting: requires a partiting schema to be defind upfront

correct_answers: A: snowflake tables are logical representations of underlying physical data

question: 41. which of the following are true multi-cluster warehouses? select all that apply below.

B: a multi-cluster warehouse can automatically turn itself off after a period of inactivity

correct_answers: A: a multi-cluster warehouse can add clusters automatically based on query activity

question: 79. What happens when a Data Provider revokes privileges to a Share on an object in their source database?

question: How is the data storage cost computed for Snowflake?

question: In which of the below scenarios will you use an external table?

correct_answers: A) You have data on the cloud providers, but the data cannot be copied or moved to any other location due to compliance regulations.
B) You have a high volume of data on the cloud providers, but we only need a part of the data in Snowflake.
